intro: Steriphoma cleomoides, commonly known as the African morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and southern Africa. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it thrives in warm, sunny conditions. Its flowers are usually bright blue or purple, and they bloom in the morning, giving the plant its common name. The leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs.
